schema.name: 2018/12/05 Burger Lunch

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat your grill or skillet over medium-high heat.
Prepare the vegetables: Peel and chop the carrots into thin slices; Trim the asparagus and cut into bite-sized pieces.
Season the burger with 0.25 tsp of salt.
Lightly brush the grill or skillet with 1 tablespoon of olive oil.
Place the burger on the grill or skillet, cooking for about 4 minutes per side or until it reaches the desired level of doneness.

While the burger cooks, add the chopped carrots and asparagus to a separate part of the grill or another skillet. Grill or sauté with a bit of olive oil until the vegetables are tender, about 6-8 minutes.
Serve the burger alongside the grilled carrots and asparagus.

schema.description: This low-carb, low-sodium, and low-sugar burger lunch is a healthy alternative for those looking to enjoy a classic dish without the guilt. Perfect for individuals following a health-conscious diet, this recipe combines the juicy, savory flavors of a traditional burger with the crisp freshness of carrots and asparagus, making it a delicious and nutritious meal option.
